title: Al Hilal SFC - Wikipedia
snippet: The club's name lasted for only one year before it was changed to its current name on 3 December 1958 by King Saud. He changed the name after he attended a tournament that was contested between the Olympic Club, Al Shabab, Al Riyadh and Al-Kawkab clubs. As soon as the club's establishment, Al-Hilal enjoyed not only grassroots support but also royal attention.

title: Who owns Al Hilal FC?
snippet: Al Nassr, and Al Hilal – have been transformed into companies, each of which is owned by PIF and non-profit foundations for each club. ... Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund has taken ownership control of four soccer clubs in the Saudi Pro League—Al-Ittihad, Al-Nassr, Al-Hilal, and ...

title: Al-Hilal United FC - Wikipedia
snippet: Al-Hilal United FC was founded in 2019 in Al Lisaili, Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and around February 2020, it was announced that Abdullah bin Musa'ad bin Abdulaziz Al Saud has ownership to the newly established club.

title: Prince Al-Waleed in talks to buy PIF stake in Al-Hilal Club | AGBI
snippet: As well as a 75 percent stake in Al-Hilal, PIF has a similar share in Al-Ahli, while it owns Al-Ittihad and Al-Nassr, home of Portuguese star Cristiano Ronaldo. Oil major Aramco owns Al-Qadsiah and the Diriyah Gate Development Authority is taking ...

title: Saudi Prince Alwaleed in Talks with PIF to Acquire Al Hilal FC - Bloomberg
snippet: Saudi billionaire Prince Alwaleed bin Talal is in talks with the Public Investment Fund to acquire a majority of Al Hilal Football Club, in what would mark one of the most high-profile privatization efforts in the kingdom’s football sector.
